messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the Spring Boot framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. To begin this process, I'll provide you with the contents of file `src/main/java/com/urcodebin/api/controllers/CodePasteController.java`, your task is to extract all instances of API entries from this file.

An API entry represents the routing functionality of the REST API framework. It refers to the structure that binds a partial or complete request path (called a "path") to a function, class, class method, or object (called a "handler") that processes requests matching that path, either by handling them directly or by dispatching them to other handlers based on the path.

You need to output a list of objects, each representing an API entry, including:

- The HTTP request path, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}). Set this to null if it cannot be determined.
- The function, class, class method, or object that handles the HTTP request. Use exactly "anonymous" to denote an anonymous implementation.
- Whether the handler's implementation (i.e., processing requests and building responses) is present in the same source code file, rather than being imported.
- Whether the path string is a prefix rather than a full path.
- Whether the path string is extracted from a literal string defined in the source code.
- Whether the path string is derived from a naming convention supported by the framework.
- Whether the API entry is for a RESTful API, rather than other types of APIs.
- Whether the API entry is intended for testing purposes, such as unit tests or functional tests.

Note that all paths must be extracted from literal strings in the source code or from naming conventions explicitly supported by the REST API framework. Do not make guesses, if you find a function, class, class method, or object that looks a lot like an API implementation, but the path is not explicitly defined in this file (perhaps in another file), do not include it in your output. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
[
  {
    "path": "/api/paste",
    "handler": "CodePasteController",
    "implementationPresentInFile": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": true,
    "pathExtractedFromLiteral": true,
    "pathDerivedFromConvention": false,
    "isRestApi": true,
    "isForTesting": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/paste/{paste_id}",
    "handler": "CodePasteController.getCodePasteFromId",
    "implementationPresentInFile": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathExtractedFromLiteral": true,
    "pathDerivedFromConvention": false,
    "isRestApi": true,
    "isForTesting": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/paste/{paste_id}",
    "handler": "CodePasteController.deleteCodePasteWithId",
    "implementationPresentInFile": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathExtractedFromLiteral": true,
    "pathDerivedFromConvention": false,
    "isRestApi": true,
    "isForTesting": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/paste/public",
    "handler": "CodePasteController.getListOfPublicPastesWith",
    "implementationPresentInFile": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathExtractedFromLiteral": true,
    "pathDerivedFromConvention": false,
    "isRestApi": true,
    "isForTesting": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/paste",
    "handler": "CodePasteController.postNewCodePasteWith",
    "implementationPresentInFile": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathExtractedFromLiteral": true,
    "pathDerivedFromConvention": false,
    "isRestApi": true,
    "isForTesting": false
  }
]

Explanation:
- The class is annotated with @RestController and @RequestMapping("/api/paste"), so the class-level path "/api/paste" is a literal prefix present in this file; I included it as an API entry that represents the prefix mapped to the controller class.
- Each controller method with @GetMapping, @DeleteMapping, @PostMapping is a route handler. Method-level path strings are either explicit literals ("/{paste_id}", "/public") or, in the case of the POST method, implicit (no method-level path) and therefore resolves to the class-level literal "/api/paste". All resolved full paths start with "/" and use curly braces for the path parameter {paste_id} as found in the source.
- All handlers are implemented in this same source file (the methods are defined here), so implementationPresentInFile is true for each entry.
- pathIsPrefix is true only for the class-level mapping; method entries are full paths (false).
- pathExtractedFromLiteral is true because the class-level prefix and the method-level path fragments (where present) are literal strings in this file. The POST method path comes from the class-level literal, so it is also considered extracted from a literal present in this file.
- None of the paths are derived from naming conventions; they are explicit mappings, so pathDerivedFromConvention is false.
- The controller uses Spring's @RestController, so these are RESTful endpoints (isRestApi true).
- There are no indications these routes are for testing (isForTesting false).
